      Player(JSONCardReader jCardReader, java.lang.String[] cardList)
      Use this directly for the remote player
      Be aware that this doen't initiate any of the JavaFX functions except for the panes that sholud be displayed on the battlefield

    • Constructor Detail

      • Player

        public Player(double width,
              JSONCardReader jCardReader,
              javafx.event.EventHandler<javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent> cardPlayHandler,
              java.lang.String[] cardList)
        Use this for the local player
        Parameters:
        jCardReader - where the cards should be read from
        cardPlayHandler - event handler for when the cards are activated in the hand and should be played
        cardList - A string array of the names of the cards desired to be created

      • Player

        public Player(JSONCardReader jCardReader,
              java.lang.String[] cardList)
        Use this directly for the remote player
        Be aware that this doen't initiate any of the JavaFX functions except for the panes that sholud be displayed on the battlefield
        Parameters:
        jCardReader - where the cards should be read from
        cardList - A string array of the names of the cards desired to be created

        public void updateScaleFactor(double newScaleFactor)
        Notify the lower classes about that everything has changed scale
        Needed for card movement to scale it to the window size
        Parameters:
        newScaleFactor - what scale the new window is to the original

      • drawCard

              throws CardNotFoundException
        Moves the next card from the deck to the hand
        Throws:
        CardNotFoundException - probably non fatal

      • drawCard

        public void drawCard(long cardId)
              throws CardNotFoundException
        Moves a set card from the deck to the hand
        Parameters:
        cardId - what card that should be drawn
        Throws:
        CardNotFoundException - probably non fatal

      • playCard

        public void playCard(Card card,
                     Battlefield targetBattlefield)
        Moves card to the table
        Parameters:
        card - the card to be move
        targetBattlefield - the battlefield that the card should end up on currently this only really works if you use "matching" player and battlefield

      • moveCardBetweenCollections

        public void moveCardBetweenCollections(CardCollection oldCollection,
                                       CardCollection newCollection,
                                       Card whatCard)
                                throws CardNotFoundException
        Move a card from one collection to another
        Parameters:
        whatCard - the card that should be moved
        oldCollection - where the card should be taken from
        newCollection - where the card sholud end up
        Throws:
        CardNotFoundException - if the card isn't in the old collection
